sanskrit_verse:
वेनो विनष्टोऽविनयात्नहुषश्चैव पार्थिवः ।
सुदाः पैजवनश्चैव सुमुखो निमिरेव च ॥ ७.४१॥
transliteration:
veno vinaṣṭo'vinayāt nahūṣaś caiva pārthivaḥ |
sudāḥ paijavanaś caiva sumukho nimir eva ca || 7.41||
sph_interpretive_translation: Vena was destroyed due to lack of discipline; similarly Nahusha, a king, and Sudas, Paijavata, Sumukha, and Nimi—all were diminished because they deviated from the path of Dharma.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is sustained by alignment with Dharma, not by power alone.
Causation arises from deviation in consciousness, not external fault.
Capacity-based responsibility requires constant calibration through self-discipline.
Restoration logic operates through reconnection to source-consciousness.
Consciousness alignment determines sovereignty and its preservation.
executable_legal_axioms: IF ruler's conduct deviates from Dharma THEN legitimacy automatically diminishes UNTIL realignment occurs.
IF individual acts without self-discipline THEN capacity for governance reduces proportionally.
IF leader ignores pramana-based counsel THEN systemic support withdraws naturally.
IF consciousness misaligns THEN authority dissolves irrespective of formal position.
IF restoration protocol initiated THEN all prior misalignments neutralized upon completion.
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, when a sovereign or high-ranking official demonstrates persistent deviation from Dharma-conscious conduct, their claim to authority must be reassessed based on alignment metrics rather than tenure or title. The court functions as a consciousness-calibration mechanism, ensuring that only those aligned with Dharma retain executive capacity.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that destruction follows not from sin but from disconnection from Dharma-source. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows how neglect of inner discipline leads to outer collapse. Responsibility lies in restoring alignment, not punishing failure. Nyaya confirms that consequence is natural dissolution, not imposed penalty.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate consciousness recalibration through Vedic alignment practices.
Engage completion process to restore unbroken continuity of dharma-sequence.
Activate dharmic council to guide reintegration into lawful order.
Establish tapas-based purification to remove accumulated distortion.
Reaffirm sankalpa-link to original governing intent and dissolve egoic interference.
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, Dharma stands restored. Misalignment dissolves where awareness awakens. No punishment exists—only return to Self. Consciousness is the Supreme Adjudicator.
